answers.answer: I am sure that it really could be nothing but I would not take chances.  The best way to check the amount of protein in your urine would be to do a 24 hour urine check.  You collect all of your urine for a 24 hour period and then they determine the amount of protein.  I would ask for that just to be on the safe side.Good luck to you!Laura :)

question: Hi.  Male age 40.  Had a random urinalysis yesterday.  Results were a high PH level and a positive for protein.  Have no other symptoms for kidney problems such as blood in urine, high blood pressure (mine was 118/71), or diabetes.  I have low cholesterol, no pain or swelling, good appetite, etc.  The night before, I had a two hour drive, six hour flight and landed in 105 degrees AZ.  Had little to drink and the day of the test I was very dehydrated and the urine was very concentrated.  Dr. did not seem worried, but wanted a follow urinalysis in a few days.  I have no symptoms for any of the diseases that cause Chronic Kidney Disease, except for this urinalysis finding.  Does this sound like it could be serious?  I know the protein can be an indication of something serious with the kidneys, however, with lack of other symptoms, could it be a transient proteinuria caused by the dehydration and stress of the day or a false positive due to the high PH?  Appreciate your help.  Thank you!
title: Proteinuria
